web_research.query: What are winning approaches for text classification competitions on Kaggle that combine text features with tabular metadata?
web_research.finding:
Winning Kaggle text‑classification solutions that also have tabular metadata treat the problem as a **multimodal learning task** – the raw text is first turned into dense embeddings (usually with a pretrained transformer such as BERT, RoBERTa or a domain‑specific LLM) and those vectors are concatenated with the engineered numeric and categorical features before being fed to a powerful tabular learner or an ensemble ([AutoGluon documentation](https://auto.gluon.ai/scoredebugweight/tutorials/tabular_prediction/tabular-multimodal-text-others.html))​.  AutoGluon’s `TabularPredictor` automatically handles raw text columns, trains a suite of models (LightGBM, CatBoost, Random Forest, and a multimodal neural net that ingests the transformer embeddings) and blends them, which has become a go‑to baseline for many Kaggle competitions involving mixed data​([AutoGluon documentation](https://auto.gluon.ai/scoredebugweight/tutorials/tabular_prediction/tabular-multimodal-text-others.html))​.

A commo

web_research.query: How do Kaggle winners handle severe class imbalance in binary classification competitions with 25% positive class?
web_research.finding:
Top Kaggle winners typically combine several proven tactics to tame a 75 %/25 % class‑imbalance in binary contests — they focus on the right metric, balance the data, weight the loss, engineer robust features, and blend strong models ([Kaggle Q&A](https://www.kaggle.com/questions-and-answers/473546); [Medium guide](https://medium.com/data-science/class-imbalance-strategies-a-visual-guide-with-code-8bc8fae71e1a); [Neptune blog](https://neptune.ai/blog/tabular-data-binary-classification-tips-and-tricks-from-5-kaggle-competitions)).

1. **Pick an imbalance‑aware evaluation metric** – use AUC‑ROC, PR‑AUC or log‑loss (which penalises mis‑classifying the minority) rather than plain accuracy ([Kaggle Q&A](https://www.kaggle.com/questions-and-answers/473546)).  

2. **Resample the training set** –  
   * **Undersample** the majority class to reduce its dominance,  
   * **Oversample** the minority class or generate synthetic examples with **SMOTE**/ADASYN ([Kaggle Q&A](https://www.kaggle.com/q
